com.optimizely.ab.bucketing

Class DecisionService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.optimizely.ab.bucketing.DecisionService

  • public class DecisionService
extends java.lang.Object
    Optimizely's decision service that determines which variation of an experiment the user will be allocated to. The decision service contains all logic around how a user decision is made. This includes all of the following: 1. Checking experiment status 2. Checking whitelisting 3. Checking sticky bucketing 4. Checking audience targeting 5. Using Murmurhash3 to bucket the user.

      • DecisionService

        public DecisionService(@Nonnull
                       Bucketer bucketer,
                       @Nonnull
                       ErrorHandler errorHandler,
                       @Nonnull
                       ProjectConfig projectConfig,
                       @Nullable
                       UserProfileService userProfileService)
        Initialize a decision service for the Optimizely client.
        Parameters:
        bucketer - Base bucketer to allocate new users to an experiment.
        errorHandler - The error handler of the Optimizely client.
        projectConfig - Optimizely Project Config representing the datafile.
        userProfileService - UserProfileService implementation for storing user info.

      • getVariation

        @Nullable
public Variation getVariation(@Nonnull
                                         Experiment experiment,
                                         @Nonnull
                                         java.lang.String userId,
                                         @Nonnull
                                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> filteredAttributes)
        Get a Variation of an Experiment for a user to be allocated into.
        Parameters:
        experiment - The Experiment the user will be bucketed into.
        userId - The userId of the user.
        filteredAttributes - The user's attributes. This should be filtered to just attributes in the Datafile.
        Returns:
        The Variation the user is allocated into.
